item.title: With a major wave of evictions looming, PSL is hitting the...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

With a major wave of evictions looming, PSL is hitting the ground to talk to the community about building the struggle for rent cancellation.

The patchwork of temporary eviction moratoriums are not enough to address the colossal crisis facing the people of this country. When they expire and rent comes due, millions of people will be out on the street, including hundreds of thousands in Colorado. The people need rent and mortgage cancellation now—nothing less! #CanceltheRents
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: #BREAKING In response to protests, Governor Polis has walked...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

#BREAKING In response to protests, Governor Polis has walked back his amendment which altered the scope of the state’s investigation into Elijah McClain’s death. He has restored references to criminal offenses and prosecuting the police in the language of the order.

To be clear, this is still nothing more than a symbolic demonstration of good will. We will not settle merely for symbolic justice. We demand murder charges for Jason Rosenblatt, Nathan Woodyard, and Randy Roedema—nothing less. Our eyes are still on Polis and AG Weiser.

Salute to everyone who has been part of this movement demanding justice for Elijah McClain. This charade proves we MUST maintain vigilance and continue to fight every step of the way. The struggle continues!

Gov. Jared Polis made a second revision Wednesday to his executive order directing Attorney General Phil Weiser to investigate the death of Elijah McClain, acknowledging previous tweaks to the orde…

denverpost.com

Polis revises Elijah McClain executive order to restore reference to potentially prosecuting police

Gov. Jared Polis made a second revision Wednesday to his executive order directing Attorney General Phil Weiser to investigate the death of Elijah McClain, acknowledging previous tweaks to the orde…Gov. item.title: Denver City is sweeping 300 people who are house less from an...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver was live.

Denver City is sweeping 300 people who are house less from an encampment where some have resided for several years. This camp is the last refuge for people who have been swept all summer. Meanwhile there are enough vacant apartments and houses in Denver to house the entire 6,000+ house less population three times over. Instead of providing houses to these people, the only true solution to this crisis, the mayor would rather send police in to forcibly move people who have no where to go.

1K Views
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverZinn Education ProjectOn Nov. 29, 1864, a Colorado Calvary unit, acting on orders from Colorado's...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - DenverZinn Education Project

On Nov. 29, 1864, a Colorado Calvary unit, acting on orders from Colorado's Governor and ignoring a white surrender flag flying just below a U.S. flag, brutally... attacked Cheyenne and Arapaho Tribes including Chief Black Kettle (in photo), in what became known as the Sand Creek massacre. Captain Silas Soule (in photo), raised in an abolitionist family, ordered his troops not to participate in the attack and testified publicly about the massacre. Soule was assassinated the next year. More on the Sand Creek Massacre: http://bit.ly/V4PCmU Here is a story about Silas Soule: http://bit.ly/11j1chy (Note that the Colonel in charge of the massacre has a town named after him in Colorado, Soule does not.) We recommend a related book of YA book historical fiction called Choke Creek: http://www.chokecreek.com/ Photo: Camp Weld Conference, 9/28/1864. Front row, kneeling on right: Silas S. Soule. Middle row, seated, 3rd from left: Black Kettle.

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Thanks to artist Reed Bmore, Elijah McClain now sits above...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Thanks to artist Reed Bmore, Elijah McClain now sits above Denver playing violin to a kitten, a perfect tribute and reminder of the life APD took away.

Elijah still needs justice. We demand murder charges for Jason Rosenblatt, Nathan Woodward, and Randy Roedema. We demand restitution for the McClain family. There are so many who have stood in the way of justice who have escaped consequences, while those who have fought tirelessly for justice are facing the potential of decad...es in prison—this should be reversed.

Ultimately, justice will only be served when we dismantle the system that took Elijah’s life, and so many others like him, and we build a new society free from the brutality of the police and the racist system they serve.

Artist is @reedbmoreart on Instagram

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: “While in one breath Mayor Michael Hancock greenlights the use...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

“While in one breath Mayor Michael Hancock greenlights the use of tents on sidewalks for restaurants, with his next breath he instructs his police force to remove unhoused residents from tents alongside a vacant lot — endangering the entire Denver community in the process.

“As the encampment at Arkins Court proves, homeless sweeps do not reduce the problem of homelessness; they exacerbate it. The solution to homelessness is not violent sweeps — it is housing. Of housing, ther...e is no shortage in Denver – 20,560 vacant units sit empty within the city limits. The real crime is that the city would rather force its residents out onto the street during a pandemic than jeopardize the profits of its wealthy landlord class. We need a socialist government that would oversee the production and distribution of housing for people, not for profits.”

https://www.liberationnews.org/as-winter-approaches-denver…/

See MoreLiberation News previously reported on Denver’s non-CDC-compliant homeless sweeps in May, and as winter approaches, the city is continuing to sweep residents. item.title: Highly recommended — an excellent discussion of the real story...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Highly recommended — an excellent discussion of the real story of Thanksgiving

The Socialist Program with Brian Becker

Creation Myths Part 1: The Real Story of Thanksgiving

In the first installment of an ongoing series where The Socialist Program examines the real origins of U.S.... society, we discuss the true history of Thanksgiving. Brian and Dr. Gerald Horne talk about the history of settler colonialism in the United States, how it gave rise to slavery and white supremacist ideology, and the enduring features of U.S. society that can be traced to these phenomena.

Dr. Gerald Horne holds the Moores Professorship of History and African American Studies at the University of Houston and the author of many books, including “The Dawning of the Apocalypse: The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, Settler Colonialism, and Capitalism in the Long Sixteenth Century.” He is also the author of “The Bittersweet Science: Racism, Racketeering, and the Political Economy of Boxing.”

Listen: https://soundcloud.com/…/creation-myths-part-1-the-real-sto…

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7RedfishDiego Maradona, anti-imperialist, socialist and arguably the greatest football player of...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver+7Redfish

Diego Maradona, anti-imperialist, socialist and arguably the greatest football player of all time passed away at the age of 60.

Maradona was a leftist on the f...ootball fields and also in politics. As a football player he tirelessly fought against corruption in the International Federation of Association Football (FIFA), which he compared to a mafia. He struggled to unionize football players and in the late 90s, Maradona, with other prominent stars, formed the International Association of Professional Football Players to defend players' rights.

Maradona, also known as "El 10", openly showed his support to left-wing, socialist and progressive movements and governments in the world and specifically in Latin America. He also openly defied imperialism and colonialism and was a firm supporter of the Palestinian cause saying "in my heart I am Palestinian." and "I am a defender of the Palestinian people, I respect them and sympathize with them, I support Palestine without fear".

He proudly wore a Che Guevara tattoo on his arm and a Fidel Castro one on his leg. He was a close friend and supporter of Hugo Chavez, Evo Morales and Fidel Castro among other socialist leaders. He once said "I believe in Hugo Chávez. I am Chavista. Everything that he and Fidel do, from my point of view, is the best". As a socialist and anti-imperialist Maradona remained a committed supporter of Venezuela's Bolivarian Revolution and progressive social movements across Latin America, never losing hope in the poor and the oppressed to emancipate themselves.

"I am from the left in the sense that I am (...) for the progress of my country, to improve the life of poor people, so that we all have peace and freedom." [...] "We cannot be bought, we are lefties on the feet, we are lefties on the hands, and we are lefties on the mind. That has to be known by the people, that we say the truth, that we want equality, and that we don't want the Yankee flag planted on us."

Rest in power, Diego Armando Maradona!

(Photos via Reuters and Getty)

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Four years ago, Fidel Castro Ruiz died peacefully of natural...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Four years ago, Fidel Castro Ruiz died peacefully of natural causes at the age of 90, after having survived over 600 assassination attempts by the U.S. government during his time as a leader of the Cuban Revolution.

Fidel’s life was testament to his astonishing will to struggle, surviving hundreds of CIA assassination attempts, because of U.S. imperialism’s fear of Cuba’s example. Fidel fought without let-up for his people, for revolution, for socialism.

Fidel was the ultimat...e revolutionary. He was fully aware of his essential historic leadership in the Revolution, but just as important was his guidance in building the Communist Party of Cuba and continually inspiring a people who would fight no matter the adversities.

The revolution against the U.S. puppet Batista, which ushered in the Cuban Revolution, was carried out during what would seem an inauspicious time.

The 1950s were a time of anti-communist hysteria led by the United States which thoroughly dominated Cuba at the time and whose aim was to crush the communist movement and workers’ struggles at home and abroad. Yet, Fidel believed that after Batista’s military coup in 1952, that it was the very time to strike.

The next year, Fidel led the July 26 assault on the Moncada barracks in eastern Cuba. While the revolutionary combatants were defeated and many killed, the Moncada attack would give birth to the July 26th Movement. In 1956, Fidel and his comrades, including Che Guevara and Raul Castro, launched the guerrilla war that brought down the Batista regime on January 1, 1959.

The 1950s and 60s was also a time of emerging national liberation struggles in Africa, Latin America and Asia

Fidel’s steel determination and victory over U.S. imperialism helped revive the ideas of revolutionary socialism in Latin America and across the globe. Many national liberation struggles in Latin America, Africa and Asia gained strength from the assistance of revolutionary Cuba.

Fidel’s legacy will endure because he leaves a strong country of true revolutionaries, people who have given of themselves countless times as medical workers, as teachers, as construction workers, as military combatants, all for the liberation of humanity.

See MoreSee the results and other info about the 2020 US Election. See Election Results
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Today Leonard Peltier is at the front of our minds, suffering in...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Today Leonard Peltier is at the front of our minds, suffering in poor health at the Coleman Correctional Facility in Florida, still behind bars after more than 44 years since being framed by the FBI. He was a target of #COINTELPRO for his leadership in the American Indian Movement.

Read his 2019 Thanksgiving Statement and remember that the struggle for Native sovereignty continues and that there are still martyrs of this movement behind bars who we must fight for! #FreeLeonar...

Continue Reading

item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Tune in to the inaugural episode of the Socialist Program with Brian Becker, featuring an interview with PSL Denver’s Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero and Lillian House discussing the severe repression they are facing and the ongoing struggle for justice for Elijah McClain. #DropTheChargesCO

https://soundcloud.com/…/will-there-be-a-biden-foreign-poli…

The Socialist Program with Brian Becker

Episode 1 of The Socialist Program! In our inaugural "In the News" roundtable discussion, Brian Becker, Nicole Roussell and Walter Smolarek discuss Biden's cabi...net picks so far and what they indicate about his administration's political orientation, especially regarding foreign policy and U.S. empire.

PLUS: Joel Northam, Eliza Lucero and Lillian House -- the three Denver anti-racist organizers facing decades in prison on false charges -- join the show! They discuss the repression they have been the targets of and the ongoing struggle for justice for Elijah McClain.

item.title: Colorado’s “progressive” governor publicly stated in his...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Colorado’s “progressive” governor publicly stated in his press conference on Covid today that in his view it is less pressing to get vaccines to prisoners and ICE detainees than to others. This is doubly horrifying as incarcerated people are suffering some of the most extreme infection and death rates in the state. Policies like this suggested by Polis condemn poor people and predominantly people of color to unnecessary death.

We condemn this abhorrent policy and continue to demand the immediate mass humanitarian release of prisoners and ICE detainees. We demand adequate PPE, sanitation, and medical care for all inmates and detainees. Anything less is genocidal!
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: The city of Denver is planning a massive homeless sweep on...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

The city of Denver is planning a massive homeless sweep on Monday, Nov. 30, beginning around 7am at 29th & Arkins. The camp houses approximately 300 people—most have been funneled there from other sweeps, highlighting the unsustainability of this practice. Once again the city has no answer for where these people are supposed to go.

We want to once again point out that we have identified ten apartment buildings that together have over 1200 vacant units. These vacancies could h...ouse more people than the entire Denver shelter system and under far safer conditions in this pandemic. (Again, the CDC explicitly advises local governments AGAINST conducting sweeps during the pandemic and advocates for providing individual housing.) We call on the city to open this or similar vacant housing immediately to meet the needs of the people. We demand HOUSING—not sweeps.

Join us to protest the city’s inhumane and deadly sweeps and stand in solidarity with our unhoused neighbors. We will be heading out to the sweep at 7am Monday morning at 29th & Arkins.
Denver Homeless Out Loud

See More
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: Passive voice is often used in headlines to obscure the role of...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

Passive voice is often used in headlines to obscure the role of a guilty party e.g. "Teen killed in officer-involved shooting" instead of "Cop kills child" Here's another example. People didn't passively "slip" into poverty—whatever that means—they were callously *driven* into poverty by the US capitalist government that would rather see them die and starve on the streets than provide the basic aid they need to survive a global crisis.

Researchers looked at the devastating financial effect the pandemic has had on Americans, with Blacks, Latinos and children faring the worst.

nbcnews.com

8 million Americans slipped into poverty amid coronavirus pandemic, new study says

Researchers looked at the devastating financial effect the pandemic has had on Americans, with Blacks, Latinos and children faring the worst.Researchers looked at the devastating financial effect the pandemic has had on Americans, with Blacks, Latinos and children faring the worst.

item.title: An important read! “Biden is wasting no time preparing to put...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

An important read! “Biden is wasting no time preparing to put in place his thoroughly anti-worker, ultra-militarist government. At the time of this writing, the New York Times is reporting that long-time Biden aide Antony Blinken has secured the position of Secretary of State. Blinken was Deputy Secretary of State during Barack Obama’s presidency, where he was an advocate for some of the most destructive policies undertaken by the administration including the war on Libya and... military strikes against the Syrian government. Earlier in Blinken’s career, when he was a top aide to then-Senator Joe Biden, he advocated the colonial-style partition of Iraq along sectarian lines. Michele Flournoy, the frontrunner to be named Secretary of Defense, recently wrote an article where she emphasized how important it was that the U.S. military be able to credibly threaten to sink all Chinese vessels in the South China Sea in 72 hours.”

See MoreDesperately-needed reforms under an administration so thoroughly imperialist and reactionary can only be secured through determined, militant struggle. #Biden #wallstreet

item.title: 🌟 Don’t miss tonight’s study group on women and the mass...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

🌟 Don’t miss tonight’s study group on women and the mass incarceration system! Register now at bit.ly/breakchains1123 🌟

Two of our hosts for tonight’s event, Lillian House and Eliza Lucero, along with fellow PSL organizer Joel Northam, were recently arrested and imprisoned in retaliation for their leadership in the mass protest movement demanding Justice for Elijah McClain. They were illegally detained for eight days, under 23-hour lockdown in COVID-exposed jail units. They now face multiple extreme false felony charges with potential sentences of decades in prison.

We are asking that attendees make a minimum $5 donation for this event that will go towards the legal and political fund for the Denver organizers’ defense effort. Donations can be made at pslweb.org/donate4denver or venmo: @donate4denver.
item.author: Party for Socialism and Liberation

item.title: DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER...
item.content:encoded:
Party for Socialism and Liberation - Denver

DROP ALL THE CHARGES ON ANTI-RACIST ORGANIZERS IN THE DENVER AREA! - HOW YOU CAN HELP

On Sept. 17, police agencies in the Denver area arrested anti-racist organizers in a coordinated assault. People were arrested in a Home Depot parking lot, at their homes, and after they were pulled over while driving. Those arrested were the leaders to demand justice for Elijah McClain, who was brutally murdered by the Aurora Police Department. They are still in jail, with the exception of ...one person. They are facing multiple felony charges and years in prison in an obvious frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain.

Add your name to sign the petition and join the campaign to demand that all the charges be dropped!

Petition text:

"I demand that all charges be dropped on anti-racist organizers in the Denver area. It is an obvious political frame-up aimed at stopping the movement for justice for Elijah McClain."

You can also donate for legal and political support for the PSL organizers who were arrested: pslweb.org/donate4denver

If you are a community leader or a member of an organization you can sign our solidarity statement: pslweb.org/denverorgsolidarity

If you can support in person, you can join our emergency demonstration demanding the dropping off all charges: https://facebook.com/events/s/dropthechargesco-march-and-ral/775179416359489/?ti=icl
